com.jcabi.aspects

Annotation Type Quietly


  • @Documented
@Retention(value=RUNTIME)
@Target(value=METHOD)
public @interface Quietly
    Log all exceptions thrown out of this method and swallow them.

    This annotation should be applied only to methods that return void, in other cases the behavior might be unexpected.

    Since:
    0.7.22
    Version:
    $Id$
    Author:
    Krzysztof Krason (Krzysztof.Krason@gmail.com)
    See Also:
    http://www.jcabi.com/jcabi-aspects/
    To do:
    #1 This annotation has to be on methods returning void only. A compile-time APT processor needs to be created that will verify that only void methods have @Quietly annotations. In runtime it should throw an exception before executing of method body, if its return type is not void.
